intro: Neuburgia corynocarpa var. corynocarpa, commonly known as the Neuburgia corynocarpa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
